metadata.feature_description: Manages placement and movement of modules within content layout columns/panes.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Add module to content layout pane

steps.action: Navigate to home page and enter Edit mode
steps.expected: Page should enter Edit mode with Content Layout panes visible
steps.actual: Page entered Edit mode successfully, Content Layout panes (F30A_Pane1/2, 9977_Pane1-4) are visible with module action bars

steps.expected: Content Layout panes should display with modules and 'Add Existing Module' links
steps.actual: Both 2-column (F30A) and 4-column (9977) Content Layout modules visible with proper pane structure. Each pane shows 'Add Existing Module' link for adding modules

steps.action: Click on HOME THEATERS module in 9977_Pane1 to access action menu
steps.expected: Module action bar should appear with Move option
steps.actual: Module action bar appeared with Admin and Move options. Clicking Move revealed pane destination options

steps.expected: Module should move to the destination pane
steps.actual: HOME THEATERS module successfully moved from 9977_Pane1 to 9977_Pane4. Page refreshed to show updated layout

steps.action: Verify module placement in destination pane
steps.expected: Module should appear in the target pane (9977_Pane4)
steps.actual: HOME THEATERS module confirmed in 9977_Pane4 alongside CAMERAS module

steps.action: Click on module to access Admin menu
steps.expected: Admin menu should contain Delete option for removing module from pane
steps.actual: Admin menu displayed with Settings, Export Content, Import Content, Help, Develop, Delete, and Refresh options

steps.expected: Delete option should be clickable to remove module from pane
steps.actual: Delete option confirmed available in Admin menu. Module can be removed using this option

steps.action: Observe initial module order in 9977_Pane4 (CAMERAS then HOME THEATERS)
steps.expected: Modules should be displayed in a specific order within the pane
steps.actual: 9977_Pane4 contains CAMERAS (first) and HOME THEATERS (second) after previous move operation

steps.action: Access Move menu for HOME THEATERS module to view Up/Down options
steps.expected: Move menu should show Top, Up, Down, Bottom options for reordering
steps.actual: Move menu displayed with Top, Up, Down, Bottom options plus pane destination options

steps.action: Click 'Up' to move HOME THEATERS above CAMERAS
steps.expected: Module order should change - HOME THEATERS should appear before CAMERAS
steps.actual: HOME THEATERS successfully moved above CAMERAS. Order changed from (CAMERAS, HOME THEATERS) to (HOME THEATERS, CAMERAS)

steps.action: Verify new order in Edit mode
steps.expected: New order should persist and display correctly
steps.actual: Edit mode confirms 9977_Pane4 now shows HOME THEATERS first, then CAMERAS. Order change preserved

steps.action: Observe empty pane (9977_Pane1 after HOME THEATERS was moved)
steps.expected: Empty pane should display placeholder content in Edit mode
steps.actual: Empty 9977_Pane1 displays 'Click to add text', 'Click to add an image', 'Click to add a module' options

steps.action: Verify empty pane includes 'Add Existing Module' link
steps.expected: Empty panes should provide ways to add content
steps.actual: 'Add Existing Module' link present in empty pane, allowing users to add modules

steps.action: Observe pane visibility behavior for empty and populated panes
steps.expected: Empty panes should show placeholders in Edit mode, populated panes should show content
steps.actual: Pane visibility is automatic - empty panes show 'Click to add' placeholders in Edit mode, populated panes display module content correctly

steps.action: Verify all 4 panes are visible regardless of content
steps.expected: All layout panes should remain visible in Edit mode
steps.actual: All 4 panes (9977_Pane1-4) visible in Edit mode. Empty pane (Pane1) shows placeholder options, populated panes (Pane2-4) show modules

observations: No explicit pane visibility toggle UI found. Pane visibility is automatic - panes are always displayed in Edit mode regardless of content state
Empty panes provide three ways to add content: text, image, or module via inline icons, plus 'Add Existing Module' link
The Move menu provides comprehensive options: Top, Up, Down, Bottom for reordering within pane, plus destination panes for cross-pane movement
Module action bars appear as floating panels at bottom of screen when module is selected, showing module ID and title
Content Layout supports both 2-column (F30A prefix) and 4-column (9977 prefix) configurations on the same page
The inline editing mask can interfere with direct module clicks; accessing the Actions link directly works around this
